author: Sam Warner
title: Gary Neville pays for showers, toilets and lighting for homeless squatters out of his own pocket - Showbiz
text: Football pundit and Good Samaritan Gary Neville will pay for showers, toilets and lighting for homeless squatters in his new hotel, after previously allowing them to stay on the site over the winter.The hotel is being built with co-owner Ryan Giggs on the site of the old Manchester stock exchange, and as the area was lying empty housing activists started to occupy it last week. © Jo Hale/Redferns via Getty ImagesGary Neville Instead of sending them off, the pair allowed the Manchester Angels group to stay. The activists aim to use it as a stop to help local homeless people by providing meals and a place to sleep.Neville will now pay to install showers, toilets and lighting for those there, and it has also been reported that he will have staff from his Hotel Football provide meals for the squatters three times a week.The Manchester Angels wrote on their Facebook page: "He [Neville] is paying for electricians; plumbers; builders and other tradesmen to come and install temporary shower units; bathrooms; toilets; lighting etc so that the building is habitable over the winter period."(function(d, s, id) { var js, fjs = d.getElementsByTagName(s)[0]; if (d.getElementById(id)) return; js = d.createElement(s); js.id = id; js.src = "//connect.facebook.net/en_GB/sdk.js#xfbml=1&version=v2.3"; fjs.parentNode.insertBefore(js, fjs);}(document, 'script', 'facebook-jssdk'));Gary Neville is arranging for Hotel Football Old Trafford to make the evening meal for the homeless on Mondays;...Posted by Manchester Angels on Wednesday, 21 October 2015They later posted: "Gary Neville is arranging for Hotel Football Old Trafford to make an evening meal for the homeless on Mondays, Wednesday and Fridays so that they get a well-balanced nutritious meal three times a week from his chefs."Thank you Gary."The site for the boutique hotel was bought by Neville and Giggs two years ago for a reported £1.5m.The Manchester Angels plan to use the occupation to support the city's homeless with health checkups, benefits advice and workshops to help them secure jobs and accommodation.Neville and Giggs will also appear in documentary series Class of 92: Out of Their League on BBC One later in the month.
